Method Detail

generateRdf

public java.lang.String generateRdf()
                             throws TripliserException
Generate a RDF serialisation. The default mime type is application/xml+rdf which can be overridden with the setMimeType() method Warning: this method can be inefficient for large input sets, where the getTripleGraphIterator() method is preferred.

Throws:
TripliserException

writeRdf

public void writeRdf(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
              throws TripliserException
Writes an RDF serialisation to an output stream. The default mime type is application/xml+rdf which can be overridden with the setMimeType() method Warning: this method can be inefficient for large input sets, where the getTripleGraphIterator() method is preferred.

Throws:
TripliserException

generateTripleGraph

public TripleGraph generateTripleGraph()
                                throws TripliserException
Generate a triple graph, which contains a Jena model from which serialisations can be extracted. The triple graph also contain meta-data tags and reporting data about the conversion process. Ignores any scope previous defined via setMergeScope() Warning: this method can be inefficient for large input sets, where the getTripleGraphIterator() method is preferred.

Throws:
TripliserException

generateTripleGraphCollection

public TripleGraphCollection generateTripleGraphCollection()
                                                    throws TripliserException
Generate a triple graph collection, merged according to the mergeScope property. Merges at GRAPH scope if not defined via setMergeScope Warning: this method can be inefficient for large input sets, where the getTripleGraphIterator() method is preferred.

Throws:
TripliserException

getTripleGraphIterator

public java.util.Iterator<TripleGraph> getTripleGraphIterator()
                                                       throws TripliserException
Returns a graph per resource created Most efficient for large input sets, Merges at GRAPH scope if not defined via setMergeScope GRAPH_MAPPING and RESOURCE_MAPPING are not valid scope for iteration based approach. This is because the entire input set would need to be processed before all triples per mapping could be determined. The collection based approach is more suitable for mapping-scope graphs.

Throws:
TripliserException
See Also:
generateTripleGraphCollection()

setMergeScope

public Tripliser setMergeScope(Constants.Scope mergeScope)
                        throws TripliserException
Defines the scope at which triples are merged into a graph. MAPPING - All triples are placed into a single graph, INPUT - A graph is created from the data in each input, GRAPH_MAPPING - For each <graph/> a triple graph is created, GRAPH - For each query result from a <graph query="?"/>, RESOURCE_MAPPING - For each <resource> (per graph query result), RESOURCE - A triple graph is created for every resource definition constructed

Parameters:
mergeScope - The scope at which to merge
Throws:
TripliserException

setInput

public Tripliser setInput(java.lang.String input)
                   throws TripliserException
Sets a single input String. This can be either a serialised input, or a reference to a data source. How inputs are handled is determined by the mapping XML file. Default behaviour is to treat all inputs as XML files.

Parameters:
input - The input as a String from which the triple data will be extracted by queries
Throws:
TripliserException

setInputStream

public Tripliser setInputStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                         throws TripliserException
Sets a single InputStream

Parameters:
inputStream - The input as an InputStream from which the triple data will be extracted by queries
Throws:
TripliserException

                          throws TripliserException
Sets a multiple InputStreams

Parameters:
inputStreams - The inputs as a list of InputStreams from which the triple data will be extracted by queries

setInputIterator

public Tripliser setInputIterator(java.util.Iterator<java.io.InputStream> inputIterator)
Provides multiple InputStreams as input in an Iterator. This allows for more efficient loading of input data.

Parameters:
inputIterator - The Iterator providing each InputStream

setSupportingInputs

public Tripliser setSupportingInputs(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> supportingInputs)
                              throws TripliserException
Sets a map of supporting inputs

Parameters:
supportingInputs - A map of supporting inputs, each with a String key to allow them to be referenced in the mapping file
Throws:
TripliserException

Throws:
TripliserException

setMimeType

public Tripliser setMimeType(java.lang.String mimeType)
                      throws TripliserException
Set the default mime type used to generate triple graphs. Determines the output of generateRdf(). Allowable mime types:
  • text/rdf+n3
  • application/x-turtle
  • text/plain
  • application/rdf+xml+abbr*
  • application/rdf+xml
*This is not a W3C valid mime type, but is used to produce abbreviated RDF XML.

Parameters:
mimeType - The mime type to produce.
Throws:
TripliserException
